title: December Stability Updates
description: Cursor rolled out updates in December 2025 with emphasis on #Stability improvements for holiday coding. The updates were being slowly rolled out over the week to ensure no regressions during the holiday period.

title: Gemini 3 Flash Availability
description: Gemini CLI announced Gemini 3 Flash availability and opened waitlist for Gemini 3 Pro. The latest version 18.0 (released November 17) includes experimental permission improvements with a new policy engine for enhanced user and administrator controls. Gemini 3 Flash claims 78% SWE-bench Verified score for agentic coding.

community_feedback.quote: Gemini 3 is not as good as everyone is saying... ChatGPT is significantly better
Users were cautious in their early reactions, discussion centered on published benchmark scores
Gemini 3 Flash is better, faster and cheaper than 2.5 Pro

title: GPT-5.2 Model and Enhanced Collaboration Features
description: GitHub Copilot added OpenAI's newest GPT-5.2 model with long context capabilities and front-end UI generation, available to Pro, Pro+, Business, and Enterprise tiers. New sharing features for Copilot Spaces enhanced collaboration. Visual Studio Copilot received updates including SymbolAware Multi-File Editing for C++ development in Visual Studio 2026 Insiders. Public preview access expanded for new model options.

community_feedback.quote: GPT 5.2 is CRUSHING opus??? Follows instructions more closely, hallucinates less, understands requests in human terms much better
Why does GPT-5.2 stop so much? Had to prompt 'continue' 10 times for a single request
ChatGPT 5.2 eating my premium request without doing anything
Happened on my first try as expected (GPT models sucks in Copilot)

title: Custom Slash Commands and API v3 Updates
description: Devin released Custom Slash Commands feature allowing users to create custom commands. API v3 updates added enterprise and organization-level Notes and Playbooks routers. Various performance improvements and minor bug fixes were included.

title: Version 2.0.x with LSP Support and Async Sub Agents
description: Claude Code released version 2.0.x (v2.0.74 as of December 2025) with major new features including LSP (Language Server Protocol) support for real-time diagnostics and go-to definitions, prompt suggestions with Tab accept, async sub agents for concurrent operations, background agents, and Opus 4.5 integration. UI/UX improvements include reduced terminal flickering and loading indicators. Holiday special (Dec 25-31) doubled usage limits.

community_feedback.quote: Disable auto-updates and stay a few updates behind unless you REALLY need a new bug fix
This LSP support is a good start but without the mutation functions it is still pretty lackluster. Plus LSPs aren't as good as JetBrains...
I'm using it to make a huge difference in my coding workflow
LSP support in Claude Code is pretty raw still - Bugs in different LSP operations, no documentation, no UI indication that LSP is working
